title: Board stoush: Cromwell clashes with major shareholder
text:
"As has become evident, ARA and Cromwell Property Group compete in the same or similar markets in a number of jurisdictions, including Australia, Asia and the United Kingdom."

As well, Cromwell noted that Dr Weiss may already be over-committed with six other directorships and that his skill set was either already represented on the board or "unlikely to contribute to the current strategy and direction" of Cromwell".

Cromwell has appointed two new independent directors, Lisa Scenna and Tanya Cox, whose positions it will look to confirm at the annual general meeting.

ARA, led by industry veteran Mr Blight in this country and the Brisbane-based fund manager which is led by Paul Weightman, have been at loggerheads for months over a series of issues.

Cromwell chief executive Paul Weightman. Glenn Hunt

Differences over company strategy emerged as early as April after Cromwell’s takeover bid for British-listed RDI REIT fell over.

In May, ARA requested Cromwell’s shareholder register, a move that can be a preliminary step to calling a shareholder meeting, prompting Cromwell to warn its own shareholders to treat any unsolicited communication from the Singaporean player “with circumspection”.

The two property players clashed again in June when ARA denied a position in the Brisbane-based fund manager’s $375 million fundraising. Mr Blight stepped down from the board soon after.

ARA's response to Cromwell's rejection was swift, with one inside from the Singaporean's camp claiming on Monday morning that the Brisbane fund manager had made no attempt to discuss with Dr Weiss how potential conflicts could be managed.

ARA was "quite astounded" by the Cromwell's stance, according to the insider, describing the fund manager's position as "incredibly frustrating" and said it had adopted a "belligerent position" towards its largest shareholder.

Cromwell's arguments against Dr Weiss's nomination were "nebulous and didn't stand up to scrutiny", the ARA insider said.
description: Property fund manager Cromwell is opposing the nomination to its board of Gary Weiss from its largest shareholder ARA.
